RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 2 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run thi s race over the turfcourse, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIDESWIPED rated along early off the top pair, asked while racing three deep just past the three eighths pole, raced from the outside of Cuenca in the stretch run and just got up under all out pressure. CUENCA showed good early foot to set the early pace from the inside, was collared just past the eighth pole, dug in and missed in a game effort. BECKON prompt the early leader from the outside two deep and was empty the final quarter of a mile. TREASURE TAILS was void of early speed and trailed.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main tr ack at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE RED BUTTON was quick to begin from the outside to cross over to race near the rail early, confidently ridden through the far turn and drew off to be clear under steady handling. BOSS CARA chased the early pace three deep, was three to four wide around the far turn and kicked on late to get up for the place position while racing from the outside. CINQUE AMORE was coaxed along two deep between early on, hard ridden through the far turn and weakened a bit the final eighth of a mile. STARSHIP BLANCA chased the early leaders from the inside and lacked a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Starship Blanca
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John and Longball Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Cinque Amore
ENTRY.OWNER: Pewter Stable and Parker John E

ENTRY.NAME: Boss Cara
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, 3-4 wide turn, up place, outside

ENTRY.NAME: Little Red Button
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick to begin, held well, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 92. Claiming Purse 20800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course it will be run on the m ain track at One Mile. If more than 10 horses remain it will be run at One Mile and Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).

CLAIM.OWNER: O'Hara, Jr., Robert and Gower, Gwyneth

RACE.FOOTNOTES: DYNAMITE KARMA rated along three to four wide early on, took aim two deep near the quarter pole, raced off the inside through the upper stretch and held to prove best under strong handlng. JAYJAYDEE settled off the early going, advanced towards the leaders into the far turn, raced five wide into the upper stretch and finished gamely to the wire. ONCE A GIANT was unhurried early, made an early three wide bid to challenge near three eighths pole and flattened out while racing from the outside. DAMIR tracked the early leader from the inside of P H Factor and faded through the far turn. P H FACTOR was off a step slow, edged up early three deep to set the early pace from the outside of foes and was empty the final quarter of a mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamite Karma
ENTRY.OWNER: Premier Stable and Brown Jr Donald L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 91. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 22000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $25,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRITICAL THINKING tracked the early leader two deep, moved up three wide near the three sixteenths pole to collar the leader, dug in late and prevailed under all out pressure. MR JACK showed good early foot two wide early, challenged from the outside through the upper stretch from Critical Thinking, dug in late and just missed in a game effort. SKIMBLE SHANKS stalked the pace three deep, made a four wide bid to challenge near the quarter pole and finished willingly to the wire. HEXAGON dropped back off the early pace, raced near the inside and lacked a bid. SYNONYM broke awkwardly, lost a considerable amount of ground at the start, raced near the back after the bad start, was five deep into the upper stretch and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: Critical Thinking
ENTRY.OWNER: Shea Lydee Losey Robert and Cassel Cleon

ENTRY.NAME: Skimble Shanks
ENTRY.OWNER: Rock Bottom Ranch and Warrior's Reward LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Synonym
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke awkwardly, no speed, 5wd upper stretch, no bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 76. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 20000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JULY 27, 2022 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BILLIEANNE stalked the pace from the outside of foes, moved up four to five wide around the far turn, dug in late and edged clear under strong handling while racing three deep. LANFRANKOPHILE coaxed three deep early on, took aim four wide near the three sixteenths pole, angled out and finished gamely to the wire. QUEEN ROSEMARY pressed the early leader two deep early on and kept on willingly to the wire. KATY THE CAT settled to race mid pack early on, was four deep near the three sixteenths pole and raced even late with no closing run. TERPEYE was off slowly, void of early speed, raced three wide in the lane and showed late interest to improve position. SNAPPY RIDE dropped back early, raced from the outside in the lane and lacked a bid. PSYCHE vied for the early lead from the inside and was empty in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Terpeye
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, void of speed, moved up, 3p

ENTRY.NAME: Snappy Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, outside lane, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Lanfrankophile
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed 3p, 4 wide between 3/16, shifted out, game

ENTRY.NAME: Billieanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside foes, 4-5 wide turn, driving, 3p

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 27 Allow ed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KISS THEM DEADLY was quick to begin to assume command, raced near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and held gamely to remain clear under steady pressure. GET DOWN BROWN rated along the inside, eased out through the far turn, raced four wide into the upper stretch and kept on gamely to the wire. UPSTATE AND BACK settled off the early going, raced near the rail in the drive and moved up to improve position. TUDOX OPPORTUNITY was coaxed along two deep early and weakened in the drive. MACHO HONCHO raced mid pack early, was five deep into the upper stretch and lacked a bid. SPINNING MUSICIAN dropped back early on, raced four wide near the three sixteenths pole and had no late rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Kiss Them Deadly
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick to begin, held gamely, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Macho Honcho
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5wd upper stretch, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Upstate and Back
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, rail bid, moved up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 27 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YES IT'S ROO settled off the early pace, waited patiently for room near the quarter pole, slipped through the upper stretch along the rail and kicked on gamely to get up under steady handling. WAGON BOSS was off slowly, moved up early to stalked the pace from the inside, shifted three deep to challenge near the quarter pole and finished willingly to the wire. SON OF A BEAST showed good early foot from the inside and kept on willingly to the wire. MY BLUE EYES prompt the early leader two deep from the outside and weakened in the drive. JUMPMASTER dropped back off the early pace, saved ground around the far turn and had no late rally whlle racing near the inside. ARISTOCAT raced mid pack early on, loomed up five wide near the quarter pole and was empty in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Son of a Beast
ENTRY.OWNER: J A G Racing and Jettany Thoroughbred Corp.

ENTRY.NAME: Jumpmaster
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Yes It's Roo
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, waited 1/4, rail upper stretch, driving,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. Stephen G. Jackson & Debbie Jackson
